metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14928 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
evolution-data-server (eds) through 3.36.3 has a STARTTLS buffering issue that affects SMTP and POP3. When a server sends a "begin TLS" response, eds reads additional data and evaluates it in a TLS context, aka "response injection."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

evolution-data-server - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
evolution-data-server-common - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
evolution-data-server-online-accounts - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
gir1.2-ebook-1.2 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
gir1.2-ebookcontacts-1.2 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
gir1.2-edataserver-1.2 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libcamel-1.2-54 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libebackend-1.2-10 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libebook-1.2-16 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libebook-contacts-1.2-2 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libecal-1.2-19 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libedata-book-1.2-25 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libedata-cal-1.2-28 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libedataserver-1.2-21 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
libedataserverui-1.2-1 - 3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: evolution-data-server package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.5-1ubuntu1.3').
